senses.sense_definition: Having a soul or spirit; often used in combination with other words to describe the nature of one's spirit.

examples.text: The philosopher argued that humans are <w>souled</w> beings, distinct from the physical world.
He was remembered as a noble-<w>souled</w> leader who cared deeply for his people.

senses.sense_definition: Possessing deep feeling, emotion, or spiritual depth.

examples.text: Her performance was incredibly <w>souled</w> and moved the audience to tears.
The artist created a deeply <w>souled</w> portrait that captured the subject's grief.

senses.sense_definition: Simple past and past participle of <w>soul</w>.

examples.text: In the myth, the god fashioned the clay and <w>souled</w> it with divine breath.
The ancient instrument was said to be <w>souled</w> by the spirits of the forest.
